result.execSummary:
The defendant James D. Marshall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with firearms/dangerous weapons.
Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.

No contact with victim or her minor child, including during period of initial confinement. Court or agent can modify contact during extended supervision period.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Batterers Intervention program. 
Cognitive Thinking Class.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Count six.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant.Received & Filed, Victim Impact Statement -reviewed by the court.

AS TO COUNT 6
The court sentenced the defendant to 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison with Count 4 & cases 15CF426 & 14CF5700, consecutive to all other counts and cases. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision on Count 4 and cases 15CF426 & 14CF5700, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

AS TO COUNT 4
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, consecutive to all other counts and cases, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR & 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Batterers Intervention program. 
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Cognitive Thinking Class.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No contact with firearms/dangerous weapons.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim or her minor child, including during period of initial confinement. Court or agent can modify contact during extended supervision period.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DV surcharges from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence..
Received & Filed, State's Sentencing Memorandum.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution.
AS TO COUNT 6
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 6 AMENDED To remove the Repeater enhancer 939.62(1)(a).
AS TO COUNTS 4 & COUNT 6 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 8 & 9
Pursuant to plea negotiations on a motion of the state the court ordered Counts 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 8, & 8 Dismissed,  But Read In.

Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Court VACATED the Jury Trial date. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Br. 23 is in trial, case spun to Judge Dallet, branch 40.

ADA DeSiato and Defense Attorney Kuehn in court to request matter be set for a plea date, prior to Jury Trial date of 6/22/2015 at 8:30 AM. Case remains set for Jury Trial and is set for a Plea Hearing on 6/16/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23. Parties advised of court calendar constraints. State advised court it will produce defendant from the Wisconsin State Prison system.
Received & Filed, Notice of Motion and Supporting Memorandum of Law to Admit 911 Recordings (from incidents dated October 16, 2011 and November 16, 2014).
Received & Filed, State's Requested Jury Instructions.
Received & Filed, State's Witness List.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Discussion regarding joinder of 15CF1552, 14CF5700, and 15CF426. Arguments form state and defense. For reasons placed on the record the court GRANTED joinder of all three matters for Jury Trial. Discussion regarding Jury Trial dates. Court ordered all cases transfered to branch 23. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Discussion and argument from defendant and state as to defendant's PRO SE motion to dismiss, DENIED by the court. Matters remain set for Jury Trial on 6/22/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn. Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Molly M Schmidt for Abbey DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Continued Preliminary hearing. Hearing proceeded. Witnesses ordered sequestered. Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Kyle Baus. Sworn for the state; Milwaukee Police Officer Chad Poeppey. Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Larry Leibsle.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Defense challenged counts 6-9. Arguments from both parties. Court DENIED defense challenge. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. State to provide discovery to defense counsel by 10:00 AM on 06/01/2015. Case set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial dates. Defendant ordered produced for both hearings. Court to address joinder of 15CF1552, 14CF5700 & 15CF426 on date of Final Pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Attorney Kuehn in branch 03, unable to appear. Court adjourned matter to 5/28/2015 at 1:30 PM.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case Recalled. State's requested for adjournment of preliminary Hearing argued, defense objected. Court GRANTED adjournment. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Continued Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Kyle Baus. Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Jeffrey Eder. The state requested an adjournment of the Preliminary Hearing. Discussion regarding scheduling. Case passed to allow court to take verdict on a pending Jury Trial in branch 23. Case passed.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.
CORRECTION: Motion to withdraw entry reflects corrected information as to filed criminal complaint.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjournment of the Preliminary Hearing requested by defense.  Defendant waives limites.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Received & Filed, Amended Criminal Complaint. Copy provided to defense, Initial Appearance on Criminal Complaint NOT held. Amended Complaint Reads:
COUNT 1: Stalking Resulting In Bodily Harm, Domestic Abuse, Repeater, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.32(2) and (3)(a), 939.50(3)(f), 968.075(1)(a), 939.62(1)(b), a class F Felony.
COUNT 2: Strangulation & Suffocation, Domestic Abuse, Repeater, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.235(1), 939.50(3)(h), 968.075(1)(a), 939.62(1)(b), a class F Felony.
COUNT 3: 
COUNT 4: Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse, Repeater, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 968.075(1)(a), 939.62(1)(b), a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 5: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, Repeater, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 968.075(1)(a), 939.62(1)(b), a class B Misdemeanor.
COUNT 6: Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse, Repeater, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 968.075(1)(a), 939.62(1)(b), a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 7: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, Repeater, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 968.075(1)(a), 939.62(1)(b), a class B Misdemeanor.
COUNT 8: Disorderly Conduct, Use of A Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse, Repeater, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 939.63(1)(a), 968.075(1)(a), 939.62(1)(b), a class B Misdemeanor.
COUNT 9: Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse, Repeater, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 968.075(1)(a), 939.62(1)(b), a class A Misdemeanor. 

Defense Counsel advised court there has been a breakdown in the attorney-client relationship, and requested to withdraw. Court GRANTED withdraw of Attorney Goodrich as counsel in this matter. Defendant advised of and WAIVED time limits as to the Preliminary Hearing to allow new counsel to be appointed. This matter set for Status of Counsel date & Preliminary Hearing  date and with cases 14CF5700 & 15CF426 adjourned for Status of Counsel dates in branch 23. Court will address state's motion for joinder of 14CF5700, 15CF426 & 15CF1552 for trial, and transfer of 14CF5700 & 15CF426 to branch 23. Speedy Trial Demand remains in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23.  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich NOT in court, defendant James D. Marshall not in court, in custody.  Molly Schmidt for Abbey DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Bail/Bond Hearing. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel unable to appear in trial in branch 04. Case adjourned to branch 23 for previously set Preliminary Hearing date. Court to address bail and State's joinder motion on that date. Case adjourned to branch 23 on 4/20/2015 at 8:30 AM.
LETTER FROM DEFENDAND REQUESTING SUBSTITUTION OF COURTROOM FOR HIS HEARING, FILED

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Francisco Araiza. Defendant James D. Marshall in custody. Ronald Dague appeared for the State. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Recalled case. Defendant was given corrected date for Preliminary hearing on 04-20-2015 at 8:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Br. 23.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND as to the misdemeanors.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sara H., T.O. (DOB 7-5-01) J.M. (2 y/o), L.M. (3 months old).

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defense moves to dismiss Counts 1,3,4,5,6,8,10,12  and repeater enhancer on each count, for lack of probbale case. Arguments heard. Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 4,5,6,7,8,9,10,11, and 12  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
